items.title: Three brothers among 35 killed as freezing conditions grip US
items.description: Much of the US was not forecast to get above freezing all day on Tuesday, local time, with temperatures plunging again overnight.

items.title: Trump administration sued by families over deadly Venezuelan boat strike
items.description: Families of two men allege they were murdered in a US missile strike off Venezuela's coast while returning to the Caribbean island nation of Trinidad.

items.title: NASA and GE Aerospace complete first hybrid electric jet engine test

featured_image.name: NASA, GE Aerospace Hybrid Engine System Marks Successful ...

items.description:
NASA and GE Aerospace have completed the first ground test of an integrated hybrid electric jet engine designed to power commercial airliners, marking a major step toward more fuel-efficient aviation.

The demonstration, conducted in December at GE Aerospace's Peebles Test Operation facility in Ohio, tested a modified Passport turbofan engine fitted with electric motor-generators capable of transferring, extracting, and injecting power during flight operations. The companies announced the successful milestone on January 26.[1][2][3]

items.title: Rose Byrne and Jacob Elordi bag BAFTA nominations
items.description: The Australian hopefuls are nominated in the acting categories, but One Battle After Another leads the field with fourteen nods.

items.title: Milano Cortina 2026 Olympics races to make snow as winters warm

featured_image.name: Italian snowmaking expert explains his role at Winter Olympics

items.description:
Snowmaking crews at the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics are racing against time to prepare competition surfaces as climate change continues to shrink the windows of freezing temperatures needed to produce artificial snow.

With the opening ceremony scheduled for February 6 in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, organizers have relied heavily on snowmaking infrastructure to supplement increasingly unpredictable natural snowfall in Italy's Alpine venues. Recent snowfall over the past weekend has provided relief, but the long-term trend is clear: winters are warming, and the margin for error is narrowing.

items.title: World marks 80 years since Auschwitz liberation

featured_image.name: Auschwitz-Birkenau On The 81st Anniversary Of Liberation

items.description:
Candles flickered at dawn Tuesday at the Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe in Berlin as people across the globe paused to observe International Holocaust Remembrance Day, reflecting on Nazi Germany's murder of millions and its attempt to annihilate Jewish life in Europe.

The annual commemoration falls on January 27, the anniversary of the 1945 liberation of Auschwitz-Birkenau by Soviet forces. This year marks the 81st anniversary of that liberation, with the United Nations theme "Holocaust Remembrance for Dignity and Human Rights" guiding observances worldwide.[1][2][3]

items.title: UNSW engineers discover solar cells can self-repair at atomic level

featured_image.name: New method helps explain how solar cells can repair ...

items.description:
Engineers at UNSW Sydney have developed a method to watch solar cells heal themselves in real time, revealing for the first time that ultraviolet damage can be reversed at the atomic level when cells are exposed to ordinary sunlight.

The research, published in Energy & Environmental Science, introduces a non-destructive monitoring technique that could reshape how solar panels are tested, manufactured, and certified for long-term outdoor use.[1][2][3]

items.title: As Trump watches on, India and EU lock in 'mother of all deals'
items.description: The agreement could impact nearly 2 billion people in both economies and comes amid an upheval in global trade stemming from Donald Trump's tariff policies.

items.title: Hungary, Slovakia to sue EU over Russian gas import ban

featured_image.name: Hungary, Slovakia to challenge EU Russian gas ban in court - Yahoo

items.description:
Hungary and Slovakia will file lawsuits at the European Court of Justice to challenge the European Union's decision to ban Russian gas imports by 2027, marking a rare direct legal confrontation between member states and Brussels over energy policy.

The announcements came after EU ministers formally approved the ban on Monday, with 24 countries voting in favor and Hungary and Slovakia voting against. Bulgarian officials abstained.[1][2]

items.title: Ocean salinity patterns can nearly double extreme El Niño risk, study finds
items.description: A subtle pattern of ocean saltiness in the western Pacific during boreal spring can nearly double the odds of an extreme El Niño event, according to new research published in Geophysical Research Letters. The study, authored by researchers from Duke University and NOAA, challenges the traditional understanding of how these climate phenomena develop.

items.title: Chinese scientists claim stealth bomber tech up to 62% faster

featured_image.name: China's New "Type B" Stealth Drone Shocks The West

items.description:
Chinese aerospace scientists have developed an active flutter suppression system that enables flying wing aircraft to operate 62.5 percent faster than previously possible while retaining their stealth characteristics, according to peer-reviewed research published in December and announced by Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics last month.

The breakthrough addresses a fundamental limitation that has constrained stealth bomber designs for decades: the trade-off between radar invisibility and speed. While flying wing aircraft like the U.S. B-2 Spirit excel at evading detection, their tailless design makes them vulnerable to dangerous vibrations at high speeds, forcing designers to limit them to subsonic flight.

items.title: Otways fire 'running hard and fast' as Victorians face uncertain night
items.description: A major fire in Victoria's Otway Ranges is being fanned by strong wind gusts following a wind change early this evening, authorities say.

items.title: Why tensions in Minnesota could send the US into another government shutdown
items.description: Politicians across the spectrum in the US are looking for ways forward as public outrage intensifies in Minnesota. From a border czar to a partial government shutdown, here's what could come next.

items.title: Police reveal white ute last seen being driven by triple murder suspect
items.description: NSW Police have released images of a white ute which was last seen being driven by Julian Ingram, who is wanted in connection with the fatal shooting of three people in Lake Cargelligo.

items.title: India and EU finalize free trade deal after two decades of talks

featured_image.name: India, EU wrap up talks for landmark trade deal amid ...

items.description:
India and the European Union finalized a free trade agreement on Tuesday after nearly two decades of negotiations, creating a market of 2 billion people and representing approximately 25 percent of global economic output. The announcement came at the 16th India-EU Summit in New Delhi, where Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and European Council President Antonio Costa.[1][2][3]

"Yesterday a big agreement was signed between the European Union and India. People are calling this the mother of all deals," Modi said while inaugurating India Energy Week in Goa via video conferencing. The agreement covers about one-third of global trade and is expected to remove tariff and non-tariff barriers on more than 90 percent of goods traded between the two sides.[4][5][6]

items.title: India and China cut power emissions together for first time since 1973

featured_image.name: China renewable auction signals challenges for solar ...

items.description:
Power sector emissions in China and India declined simultaneously in 2025 for the first time in over five decades, according to a new report from the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air (CREA), as record clean energy deployment in both nations offset a surge in coal use in the United States and helped keep global emissions largely flat.[1][2][3]

The last time both countries registered a simultaneous drop in coal power output was 1973, during the global oil crisis.[3]

items.title: AI tools accelerate solid-state battery research in Asia

featured_image.name: Scientists used AI to build a low-lithium battery from a new ...

items.description:
Researchers across Asia are leveraging artificial intelligence to transform how solid-state batteries are developed, with two major advances announced this week that could speed the transition from conventional lithium-ion technology to safer, more energy-dense alternatives.

A review article published in the journal AI Agent by Tohoku University researchers outlines how AI agents are moving beyond isolated predictions to coordinate multi-step research strategies for discovering solid electrolytes, the materials that could replace flammable liquid electrolytes in next-generation batteries. Meanwhile, a team at Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST) has developed an AI framework that predicts cathode particle sizes with 86.6% accuracy while also indicating the reliability of its predictions.[1][2][3][4][5][6][7]

items.title: One Nation is 'filling the void' for many Australians, they tell us why
items.description: Support for One Nation is rising and in former National Party heartland, people gathered for a music festival have told us why.

items.title: ICE, Greenland and comments on Afghanistan show that Trump is losing control

items.description: Alex de Minaur has been knocked out of the quarterfinals by world number one Carlos Alcaraz in straight sets.

items.description: President Trump states the U.S. military conducted its first known airstrike inside Venezuela targeting a dock where drugs were allegedly loaded onto boats[1][2][4].

items.description: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to discuss advancing phase two of the Gaza ceasefire, including reconstruction and responses to Iran[1][4].

items.description: Federal agencies including DHS, FBI, and ICE investigate $110 million in suspected fraud at Minnesota child care centers following a viral YouTube video[3].

items.description: China prioritizes humanoid robots in tech race with U.S., ramping up production while warning of industry bubble and potential bottlenecks[3].
